label: Description
value: Fragment showing a design of flowers made with outlining thread and honeycomb fillings sprinkled on a ground of hexagons and arranged as a border.

label: Description
value: Scenic medallion with group of old country houses on right with stone wall with pond in center, cat-tails and trees on right colored in sepia, blue and green. Rococo border of cupids, shells and scrolls around medallion. There is a perpendicular lattice work border between same in sepia and green.

label: Provenance
value: This wallpaper came from an old house in Thetford, Vermont.

label: Description
value: Depicting scenes of the Crimean War. "Siege of Sebastopole". Picture of two sailing vessels passing in opposite directions through a channel between two forts. A town is on the left side. Large bodies of water at top and bottom. Scene is enclosed in an architectural frame of strapwork molding and cable or rope twist molding. Printed on natural color, very thin paper.

label: Description
value: Two leaf sprigs, each composed of three leaves, printed in gold with black centers. Small leaf on stem is ribbed. Printed on matte gray ground.

label: Description
value: Formerly in a house at Marblehead, Massachusetts. Shows the deep cobalt French Blue. Gray diagonal bands divide the design into diamond shaped lozenges colored blue with a fine filigree design in black. Printed in violet-blue, black and gray.

label: Provenance
value: From a house at Marblehead, Massachusetts.

label: Description
value: Depicts the story of Judith, who is kneeling before Osiah. On the floor immediately in front of Judith is the head of Holophernes lying on a blanket. Judith is offering Holophernes's head to Osiah. Behind Judith and facing Osiah, are a priest and three soldiers, all standing. Osian is standing. This scene is enclosed in a frame suggestive of transposed pedi- ments used over doors. Between the scrolls of pediments the spaces are filled in with the effect of marble. On reverse side is the English excise stamp with the word "paper" printed beneath.

label: Provenance
value: This paper was put on the walls of the ballroom of Dr. Josiah Holt's home at 307 West Street, Bristol, Connecticut, about 1780. The house is now demolished.

label: Description
value: Paper with an all-over green ground with no printed design. Has the appearance of arsenic green.

label: Physical description
value: Paper with applied ground color, unprinted

label: Description
value: Red flock, damask-like pattern, with step-edged outlines.

label: Description
value: Portion of a balustrade showing one complete baluster and portions of two others. There is a hand rail at the top and a base molding at the bottom. This balustrade design paper was used to separate two different papers in the upper and lower halls of the house at 314 Essex Street, Salem, Massachusetts. This balustrade design was also often used at the bottom of a scenic paper. Printed in grisaille and green.

label: Description
value: Very small fragmentary piece, appearing to be simulated moire or wood grain design, printed in deep blue, with clusters of small stylized white flowers printed on light blue ground. At one extreme end is part of a wreath of seven-petaled flowers with centers, all in gray. Removed from a bandbox.

label: Provenance
value: According to information obtained from a note among the papers of Grace Lincoln Temple, this small portion of wallpaper is from a bandbox belonging to Abigail Adams, 1744-1818, who was the wife of John Adams.

label: Description
value: From the same bandbox as 1942-19-8. More of the wreath of gray petalled flowers shows and also a portion of a large center flower of gray with dark blue dots for the center.

label: Provenance
value: According to information obtained from a note among the papers of Grace Lincoln Temple, this small portion of wallpaper is from a bandbox belonging to Abigail Adams, 1744-1818, who was the wife of John Adams.

Saucer (b) with everted rim decorated en suite with cup, the circular well with spray of vari-colored, petalled flowers tied with yellow ribbon.

Project for a Ballet Costume of an Oriental Jester

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. A man in Oriental costume is shown standing in three-quarter profile, turned toward left. The head is turned to the right. The right foot crosses the left one.
Costume Design: Valor and Music for a Ballet

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. A bearded man wearing a skirt is shown frontally. He raises with his right hand a mace similar to that in object 1942-3-5. A lion skin hangs around his shoulders. Written in the lower part of the right sleeve and of the skirt: "Biancho," in the bodice above the waist: "Follia morta," in two bands of its lower part respectively: "Giallo," and "Rosso." On top: "La sigra Angiolina Valors Musicha."

label: Physical description
value: Lead pencil, pen and ink on paper
Costume Design: Poetry for a Ballet

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. A woman is shown, standing, with a trumpet in her right hand, the left hand holds the neck of a violin-cello. Her coat is decorated with rows of stars. Written on top, in pencil: "La siga Cecilia," in the upper left corner: "Nobilta/o Poesia," in the upper part of the bodice, and in the left sleeve: "Biancho," in the lwoer part of the bodeice, and in the skirt: "Turchino." Written above, in ink (over pencil): "La poesia vestita di azurro celeste sopra ivi saranno/molte stelle coronate di alloro."

label: Physical description
value: Lead pencil, pen and ink on paper
